author: Brandon Hishon

text: This song perfectly fits. This ellicits such a sense of security. It's soothing, but eerie; safety, but only temporarily. There's also a great contrast in this, compared to the rest of the game's music, which, along with the repetitive and simple rhythm, makes the player subconsciously associate this song with being safe from a disparaging, dangerous environment. This song is our psychological guardian from the impending doom of the outside (of the save room) world.

author: assgoblin2damax

text: A short/simple theme but very memorable. The only place where you can actually take a breather and know you're safe from any harm. There's only one other "Save Point" theme that feels just like this one to me, from a cult game on the PS2. Can anyone guess?
author: SupraDarky
